intro: Serratula scariosa, commonly known as the scarious serratula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with a rough, scaly texture, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Serratula scariosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in poor, sandy conditions.
